chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan C Bowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: probation currently serving in Racine County

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random urine screens.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to use or possess of alcohol/controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No drug paraphernalia.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with treatment/counseling.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - (nonworking) Standard release (employment and treatment) Last 15 days STAYED, to be used at Agent's discretion. Huber/straight time to be used at Agent's discretion as well.
Consecutive to: 08CT217

Dated July 27, 2015 filed by the Department of Corrections advising the Court it supports the Defendant's request have his condition time run concurrent to 2008CT217 or to amend to allow Department to use the condition time at the Agent's discretion.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jonathan C Bowe in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. APPLY BAIL FROM THIS MATTER TO 08CT217.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3.5 years (Initial Confinement: 1.5 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation - concurrent to probation defendant is presently serving in Racine County
- 6 months Drivers License Revocation concurrent to 08CT217 and concurrent to 14CF933 (Racine Cty. Case)
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 -  90 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) consecutive to 08CT217.  Same conditions of huber as in file 08CT217.  Last 15 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/straight time to be used at the Agent's discretion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan C Bowe in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states they have an offer on these matters (14CF853, 08CT217 & 12CM2368). Defendant is involved in treatment at this time and is working. Defense requests a date in 7-8 weeks.  Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
